decks.notes: This aggressive Canadian Threshold deck focuses on quickly deploying threats like Dragon's Rage Channeler, Delver of Secrets, and Murktide Regent while disrupting opponents with counterspells like Force of Will and Daze. Wasteland is used to control the opponent's mana base, while Lightning Bolt provides additional removal and reach. The deck also includes cantrips like Ponder and Brainstorm for card selection and manipulation. The splash of green with cards like Questing Druid and Tropical Island adds versatility to the deck's strategy. Overall, the deck aims to apply pressure early and maintain tempo throughout the game.

The main concept of this Combo - Doomsday deck is to efficiently assemble the Doomsday combo in order to win the game. The deck focuses on fast mana acceleration through cards like Dark Ritual and Lotus Petal, as well as card selection and manipulation with cards like Ponder and Brainstorm. The goal is to use Doomsday to set up a winning sequence of cards, often including Thassa's Oracle, to win the game on the spot. The deck also includes disruption in the form of Thoughtseize and Force of Will to protect the combo and interact with the opponent's strategy.

This mono black combo deck focuses on using cards like Reanimate, Leyline of the Void, and Helm of Obedience to disrupt opponents' gameplans and win through powerful combos. The deck also includes disruptive cards like Thoughtseize and Hymn to Tourach to control the opponent's hand size. Dauthi Voidwalker and Troll of Khazad-d√ªm provide additional threats and the ability to disrupt graveyard strategies. The deck also utilizes mana acceleration from cards like Dark Ritual and Chrome Mox to quickly execute its game plan and overwhelm opponents.

The deck focuses on quickly assembling the combo of Cephalid Illusionist and Nomads en-Kor to mill the entire library, and then use Dread Return to reanimate Thassa's Oracle for the win. It includes protection with Force of Will and interaction with Swords to Plowshares. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while carefully executing its own combo to achieve a quick and efficient victory. It utilizes card selection tools like Brainstorm and Ponder to find the necessary pieces and maintain consistency.

This deck focuses on generating mana quickly and efficiently to cast a large number of spells in a single turn, ultimately leading to a lethal Tendrils of Agony for the win. It includes various cards that allow for card draw and manipulation, as well as protection against disruption from the opponent. The deck aims to assemble the necessary cards for the Storm combo while also being able to tutor for specific pieces with Burning Wish. The inclusion of a diverse land base also allows for flexibility in casting spells of different colors.

This deck aims to rapidly combo off by using cards like Dark Ritual, Lotus Petal, and Simian Spirit Guide to generate mana and quickly cast spells like Balustrade Spy and Undercity Informer to mill the entire deck. This allows the player to win the game by either utilizing Thassa's Oracle to win through a lack of library or by reanimating creatures like Boggart Trawler and Narcomoeba to attack for lethal damage. The deck runs disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Pact of Negation to protect the combo and achieve victory.

The main concept of the deck is to quickly and efficiently cheat powerful creatures such as Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Atraxa, Grand Unifier into play through the use of Show and Tell or Omniscience. The deck focuses on assembling the combo pieces needed to drop these big threats onto the battlefield, while also using counter magic like Force of Will and Flusterstorm to protect the combo. The deck also utilizes card selection and manipulation with cards like Ponder, Brainstorm, and Intuition to help find the necessary combo pieces.
